name: Malacca Strait
narrative: The Malacca Strait is the world's busiest shipping chokepoint, handling 25-28% of global maritime trade. Over 90,000 vessels transit annually, carrying crude oil from the Middle East to East Asia. The IMO Traffic Separation Scheme runs ~500 km between One Fathom Bank and Horsburgh Lighthouse.

name: South China Sea Main
narrative: The South China Sea main corridor connects Singapore with Hong Kong and mainland China, running west of the Paracel Islands. An estimated $5.3 trillion in goods traverse this route annually. Geopolitical tensions add risk premiums of 5-8% on shipping insurance.

name: Sunda Strait Route
narrative: The Sunda Strait route connects Jakarta with Indian Ocean ports via the strait between Java and Sumatra. Around 53,000 vessels transit annually carrying coal, LNG and iron ore. An alternative to Malacca for vessels on the Australia-India trade lane.

name: Lombok Strait Route
narrative: The Lombok Strait provides deep-water passage for VLCCs too large for Malacca. The confirmed strait center is at 115.73°E, 8.77°S with minimum depth 250m. At least 100 vessels/day transit, dominated by Australian iron ore and coal shipments heading to Indian Ocean ports.

name: Makassar Strait Route
narrative: The Makassar Strait runs 800 km between Borneo's east coast and Sulawesi's west coast, from Davao south to Surabaya. A critical corridor for VLCC tankers and bulk carriers handling ~30% of global seaborne crude oil transiting the Indonesian archipelago.

name: Singapore – Jakarta
narrative: The Singapore-Jakarta corridor (478 NM) is one of ASEAN's busiest intra-regional routes. Ships traverse the Singapore Strait and Java Sea to Tanjung Priok. Bilateral trade exceeds $50 billion annually with 12,000+ vessel movements per year.

name: Singapore – Manila
narrative: The Singapore-Manila route (1,295 NM) traverses the South China Sea via the Palawan Passage, a deep 35-40 NM wide channel west of Palawan Island. Ships approach Manila Bay from the southwest. Typhoon season causes seasonal disruptions averaging 15-20 days annually.

name: Indonesia Nickel Corridor
narrative: The Indonesia Nickel Corridor connects Mindanao and Sulawesi's nickel smelting hubs with Chinese processors via the Philippine Sea and Luzon Strait. Indonesia controls 48% of global nickel reserves — critical to EV battery supply chains. Volumes growing 25% annually.

name: Vietnam Coastal
narrative: Vietnam's coastal corridor connects Ho Chi Minh City/Cai Mep terminal with Hai Phong, running 20-50 NM offshore past Da Nang and into the Gulf of Tonkin. Vietnam's port throughput has grown 12% CAGR driven by supply chain diversification from China.

name: Palm Oil Corridor
narrative: The Palm Oil Corridor runs westbound through the Malacca Strait from Tanjung Pelepas, past Belawan/Medan on Sumatra's coast, exits north of the strait near Penang, crosses the Andaman Sea and Bay of Bengal, rounds Sri Lanka, and reaches Mumbai/JNPT. Over 9 million tonnes of crude palm oil flow annually valued at $8-12 billion.
